newsitem.title: UK: Government says British data shows rising confidence.
newsitem.headline: Government says British data shows rising confidence.

text.p: British Treasury financial secretary Michael Jack said on Friday that consumer credit data showed rising confidence in the strength of the British economy and personal borrowing remained sensible.
November net consumer credit rose 1.105 billion pounds, according to seasonally adjusted consumer credit data released by the Bank of England.
That compared with 875 million pounds in October and 600 million in November 1995.
"This is a welcome set of figures which confirm the growing confidence of individuals in the strength of the economy," Jack said in a statement read by a Treasury spokesman.
"At a personal level borrowing remains sensible and (people are) well within their ability to service the credit they want," the statement said.
